title: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns
mechanism: Plants facilitate neighboring growth through local resource modification. Facilitation competes with resource competition. When precipitation is intermittent, facilitation-competition balance creates spatial vegetation patterns. Below threshold density, vegetation collapses due to weakened facilitation (spatial Allee effect).

title: Combination therapy for colorectal cancer with anti-PD-L1 and cancer vaccine
mechanism: Tumor cells release antigens activating immune T-cells. T-cells attack tumor reducing growth. Tumor evolves PD-L1 expression to suppress T-cell response (escape). Anti-PD-L1 blocks suppression restoring immune attack. Vaccine increases antigen presentation. Combination creates feedback where immune response selects for tumor variants.

title: Optimal Harvesting in Stream Networks: Maximizing Biomass and Yield
mechanism: Resource stock accumulates from production flow. Exploitation (flow out) versus conservation (stock maintenance) tradeoff. Maximum sustainable yield occurs at intermediate stock level. Over-exploitation depletes stock below replenishment threshold causing collapse.

title: Uncertainty in Island-based Ecosystem Services and Climate Change
mechanism: Transmission rate increases with infected density. Recovery rate decreases infection duration. When transmission exceeds recovery (R0>1), epidemic spreads exponentially. Vaccination reduces susceptible population shifting R0 below 1. Spatial heterogeneity creates local pockets where R0 varies.

title: Collaboration for the Bioeconomy -- Evidence from Innovation Output in Sweden
mechanism: Firms collaborate forming innovation network. Central firms access diverse knowledge from multiple partners enhancing innovation output. Peripheral firms limited by fewer connections. Network structure (centrality) determines innovation capacity. Successful innovators attract more partners (preferential attachment) reinforcing centrality advantage.

title: Effects of multi-phase control mechanism on fibroblast dynamics
mechanism: Cell size determined by control mechanisms across cell cycle phases (sizer, timer, adder strategies). Division kernel and phase-specific control govern size distribution. Population-density-dependent regulation limits total cell numbers (extrinsic feedback). Cell-size-dependent regulation suppresses size variability (intrinsic feedback). Trade-off between extrinsic and intrinsic control.

title: Compartmental-reaction diffusion framework for microscale dynamics of extracellular serotonin
mechanism: Serotonin released from varicosities diffuses through extracellular space. Diffusion couples neighboring varicosities into microdomains. Uptake kinetics (reuptake) removes serotonin creating concentration gradients. Firing frequency, geometry, and uptake shape spatial serotonin reservoirs. Local versus volume transmission determined by diffusive coupling strength.

title: Learning virulence-transmission relationships using causal inference
mechanism: Pathogen virulence (harm to host) causally influences transmission rate (spread to new hosts). Increased virulence may increase transmission initially but reduces host mobility decreasing spread. Trade-off creates optimal virulence level maximizing transmission. Evolutionary dynamics drive virulence toward this optimum. Past virulence predicts future transmission but not vice versa (directional causality).

title: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
mechanism: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.

title: Strategic Interactions in Science and Technology Networks
mechanism: An agent's position in a collaboration network determines their productivity. Higher network centrality increases output through strategic complementarities with connected agents. Activity in one domain (scientific) enhances productivity in another domain (technological), but this effect is asymmetric - the reverse direction shows no detectable influence.

title: Human-AI Cooperation in Public Goods Game
mechanism: Reciprocal group dynamics and behavioral inertia drive cooperation levels in groups. Cooperation depends on observed group behavior patterns rather than the identity of participants. These normative mechanisms operate identically regardless of agent type, creating stable cooperation patterns through behavioral feedback.

title: Semantic Memory to Collective Creativity
mechanism: Individual semantic network topology determines ideational breadth. When agents exchange ideation traces, lower initial overlap predicts larger stimulation gains. Shared inspiration sources create network-level redundancy, forming feedback between individual cognitive structure and collective outcomes.

title: DeFi Credit Exposures and Contagion
mechanism: Token-mediated dependencies create dense inter-component connections. A shock to one component propagates through dependency links causing contagion effects. Network topology and link weights determine the extent and path of cascading failures across the system.

title: Chaotic Dynamics in Black Holes
mechanism: Particle motion in extremal configurations exhibits positive Lyapunov exponents indicating sensitivity to initial conditions. Chaos persists even at zero temperature. System parameters (spin, charge) modulate chaos strength - increasing one parameter strengthens chaotic behavior while the other weakens it.

title: Critical Slowing Down at Bifurcations
mechanism: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.

title: Thermalization in Discrete Systems
mechanism: Local ergodicity in subsystems, rather than global ergodicity, enables thermalization. Subsystem dynamics appear pseudorandom due to local interactions. Statistical properties of observables emerge from this effective local randomization without requiring the entire system to be ergodic.

title: Parametrically Excited Oscillator
mechanism: Time-periodic stiffness variation induces parametric excitation in coupled components. Nonlinear restoring forces and friction interact to produce a spectrum of dynamic responses including periodic, quasi-periodic, and chaotic behaviors. System parameters (stiffness degree, mass symmetry, friction) determine stability boundaries and response amplitude.

title: Controlling Extreme Events in Networks
mechanism: A single driving signal applied to one network component suppresses extreme events throughout the system. In coupled components, drive breaks phase-locking between elements. In networked systems, drive disrupts protoevent frequency dynamics causing frequency decoupling that prevents extreme event cascades.

title: Group Selection and AI Substitution
mechanism: AI use reduces cultural variance in populations. Under individual selection, agents relying heavily on AI (substitutes) outcompete those using AI as complement, despite reducing variance more. Group selection can favor agents that maintain variance through complementary AI use when group boundaries are strong, creating selection-level competition.

title: R&D Spillovers and Regional Innovation
mechanism: R&D spillovers from one entity enhance innovation in neighboring entities. Strategic interactions follow Stackelberg dynamics where leaders and followers reach Nash equilibrium. Highly-qualified employment amplifies spillover effects, creating synergies between different types of R&D investment and regional innovation output.

title: Seed Node Position and Network Damage
mechanism: Localized damage initiates at a seed node and propagates to neighbors. The structural position of the seed node (local connectivity and topology) amplifies or dampens damage progression. Cumulative link severing during attack progression depends critically on seed node characteristics rather than average network properties.

title: Growth Models Under Catastrophes
mechanism: Catastrophic events trigger population dispersal strategies. Dispersion affects survival probability and extinction time. Spatial constraints modulate the effectiveness of dispersal - unconstrained dispersion improves survival while spatial limits reduce the benefit, creating a trade-off between mobility and stability.

title: Habitat Heterogeneity and Metacommunity Dynamics
mechanism: Spatial structure and dispersal networks jointly determine species persistence. Heterogeneous habitats support stable coexistence only above a critical heterogeneity threshold. Homogeneous environments allow coexistence only in a fine-tuned marginal state, creating instability. Network topology encodes dispersal effectiveness through an effective kernel.

title: Fish Migration and Feller Condition
mechanism: The ratio between diffusion and drift (Feller condition) determines qualitative migration properties. High diffusion relative to drift creates randomized, intermittent movement patterns. Low ratio produces more deterministic, continuous movement. This ratio acts as a control parameter governing timescale-dependent behavioral transitions.

title: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Kinship Networks
mechanism: When agents fall below a resource threshold, they solicit resources from connected neighbors based on relatedness. Redistribution creates feedback between kinship network structure and reproduction ability. This enables population survival at lower resource densities but increases network heterogeneity and local centralization.

title: Free-Rider Problem in Shared Resources
mechanism: Shared resource use creates a cooperation dilemma with cleaning costs, contamination risk, and social incentives forming competing pressures. Cleaning cost primarily determines stability of altruistic behavior. The system exhibits multi-stability and hysteresis - small parameter changes can cause abrupt shifts between cooperation and free-riding equilibria.

title: From Discrete to Continuous Mixed Populations of Conformists, Nonconformists, and Imitators
mechanism: Three behavioral types interact: conformists benefit from choosing common strategies, nonconformists profit from rare strategies, and imitators copy highest earners. Population proportions fluctuate in finite populations but equilibrate as population size increases. Strategy proportions undergo perpetual oscillations in small populations, but fluctuation amplitudes approach zero in large populations through stochastic averaging.

title: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
mechanism: Individual behaviors shape reputation through social norms while simultaneously affecting collective resource levels. Environmental changes alter payoff structures, creating feedback between strategic behavior and resource dynamics. Reputation-based cooperation interacts with ecological constraints - cooperative behaviors deplete or enhance shared resources, which then reshape the incentives for future cooperation.

title: Multi-strain SIS dynamics with coinfection under host population structure
mechanism: Multiple pathogen strains circulate and co-infect hosts with different susceptibilities and clearance rates. Host population structure creates differential transmission pathways across classes. Strain interactions through coinfection alter individual transmission dynamics. Class-specific epidemiological traits modulate strain competition and coexistence patterns.

title: Epigenetic state inheritance drivers drug-tolerant persister-induced resistance
mechanism: Drug-tolerant persister cells inherit epigenetic states non-genetically. Under treatment pressure, persisters survive while sensitive cells die. Persisters can revert to sensitive states or acquire genetic resistance. Epigenetic state switching rates and treatment intensity determine population evolution between sensitivity, tolerance, and resistance.

title: Cell size control in bacteria
mechanism: Cell size fluctuates due to noisy growth rates and size-dependent division noise. Size homeostasis mechanisms compensate for fluctuations through size control strategies. Population dynamics alter size distributions compared to single lineages - exponential population growth changes the effective size control measured in constant-volume experiments. Extrinsic growth noise and population structure jointly determine observed size distributions.

title: Technology Adoption and Network Externalities in Financial Systems
mechanism: Technology adoption spreads through spatial and network channels. Spatial spillovers and network externalities interact multiplicatively - nearby adoption and connected peer adoption amplify each other. Cumulative adoption pressure accumulates along stochastic paths through spatial-network space. Network position amplifies or dampens spatial effects, creating non-linear adoption dynamics.

title: Mean-Field Price Formation with Network of Relative Performance Concerns
mechanism: Agents care about their performance relative to connected peers. Relative performance concerns create strategic interdependencies through network links. Risk-taking behavior adjusts based on peer comparisons. Network topology determines how competitive pressures propagate. This peer comparison mechanism affects equilibrium asset prices through aggregated strategic adjustments.

title: Who sets the range? Funding mechanics and context in crypto markets
mechanism: Funding rates in perpetual futures impose economic costs on leveraged positions. High funding creates pressure to reduce directional exposure. Capital rebalancing occurs when funding costs exceed expected returns. Funding mechanisms act as negative feedback regulating trader behavior - extreme positions become economically unsustainable, creating mean-reverting pressure that defines trading ranges.

title: Manipulation in Prediction Markets
mechanism: Manipulators with high budgets attempt to distort prediction market prices. Informed traders with correct beliefs observe price distortions and increase their opposing bets. Market depth and information heterogeneity determine manipulation effectiveness. When information is dispersed, manipulation can temporarily move prices, but informed arbitrage eventually corrects mispricing. Manipulator budget and trader information quality create a competitive dynamic.

title: Who Restores the Peg? Stablecoin Market Dynamics
mechanism: Stablecoin prices de-peg during stress events. Arbitrageurs restore the peg by trading against deviations. Arbitrage profitability depends on deviation magnitude and transaction costs. Insufficient arbitrage activity allows persistent de-pegging. Mean-field dynamics aggregate individual arbitrage decisions into collective peg restoration. Market participant heterogeneity and risk aversion determine collective restoration speed.

title: Metastability and ripening of multi-component liquid mixtures
mechanism: Multi-component mixtures undergo phase separation through unstable coexistence. Droplets grow via Ostwald ripening with characteristic scaling (radius ~ t^1/3, number ~ n^-2/3). Glass-like relaxation emerges from disordered interactions among components, creating long-lived metastable states. Different wetting angles characterize metastable configurations. Relaxation delay arises from kinetic barriers between metastable states.

title: How adaptation to food resources and death rates shape oscillatory dynamics
mechanism: Microbes adapt to food supply while experiencing death. Oscillations emerge when adaptation timescale exceeds death timescale. Consumer-resource dynamics couple population growth to substrate replenishment. Multiple timescale interactions determine stability - slow adaptation relative to death enables oscillatory behavior. Necromass recycling and complementary food sources dampen oscillations by facilitating growth.

title: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species
mechanism: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.

title: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
mechanism: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.

title: The impact of heterogeneity on the co-evolution of cooperation and epidemics
mechanism: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Structural heterogeneity creates leverage points - highly connected hubs adopt protection due to amplified risk, catalyzing cooperation. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.

title: Intelligent Control of Transportation Flow in Physarum Networks
mechanism: Physarum network morphology responds to environmental stimuli by expanding or retracting tubes. Cytoplasmic flow bidirectionally transports nutrients through the network. Flow patterns optimize based on nutrient source locations. Network adapts topology through tube reinforcement when flow is high and tube degradation when flow is low. This creates an intelligent search for optimal transport paths through flow-structure feedback.

title: Emergent structures in coupled opinion and network dynamics
mechanism: Individuals' opinions and network edge weights coevolve through coupled dynamics. Interaction strength depends on opinion distance. Similar opinions strengthen network connections. Connection strength amplifies opinion influence. This creates feedback between opinion convergence and network structure formation. Interaction function form determines emergent structures and stability.

title: Cell proliferation maintains cell area polydispersity in the growing fruit fly wing epithelium
mechanism: Cell proliferation generates area variability while mechanical forces regulate packing. Cell division creates size asymmetry between daughter cells. Mechanical constraints from neighbors limit expansion. Area polydispersity emerges from balance between proliferation-driven variability and mechanical relaxation. Cell-cell adhesion and cortical tension determine equilibrium distributions.

title: Stability and robustness of a generalized pump-leak model for epithelial cell and lumen volume regulation
mechanism: Epithelial cells regulate volume through coordinated ion pumps, channels, and paracellular pathways. Pumps actively transport ions creating concentration gradients. Osmotic pressure drives water flow following ion movement. Cell-lumen interaction creates coupled volume dynamics. Pump rates, leak permeabilities, and osmotic coupling determine stability. Feedback between cell volume and pump activity maintains homeostasis.

title: Allostery Beyond Amplification: Temporal Regulation of Signaling Information
mechanism: Allosteric regulation modulates enzyme activity temporally rather than just amplifying output. Regulatory state switches affect timing of downstream signaling. Information content in signaling depends on temporal patterns not just abundance. Regulatory switching creates temporal encoding of information. Fast switching increases information transmission while slow switching filters noise.

title: Taming multiparty entanglement at measurement-induced phase transitions
mechanism: Quantum systems undergo measurement-induced phase transitions when unitary evolution competes with measurements. Below critical measurement rate, volume-law entanglement dominates. Above critical rate, area-law entanglement emerges. Measurement rate acts as control parameter for phase transition. Competing dynamics create distinct entanglement phases. Multiparty entanglement structure differs across phases.

title: Photonic neuromorphic processing with coupled spiking silicon microrings
mechanism: Coupled microring resonators exhibit nonlinear optical dynamics with internal feedback. Injection power and wavelength control dynamical regimes: analogue, spiking, or bistable responses. Nonlinearities create sharp transitions in dynamical complexity at regime boundaries. Spiking dynamics generate sparse activity patterns. Thermal bistabilities emerge at low power enhancing computational capacity. Power-wavelength phase space determines accessible dynamical states.

title: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models
mechanism: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.

title: Thermodynamic Constraints Drive Hierarchical Preemption in Cellular Decision-Making
mechanism: Under stress, cells face rapid pathway selection with ATP scarcity. Continuous ATP regeneration rescues sporulation despite 99.7% ATP depletion. GTP accumulates as energy buffer while ATP regenerates preventing complete depletion. Stochastic regulatory transitions couple to continuous metabolic flux. Energy efficiency emerges from interplay between discrete regulatory logic and continuous thermodynamic constraints. System robustness through dynamic energy management enables 16-fold efficiency gain under stress.

title: Coarse-graining and stochastic oscillations in cell-size homeostasis
mechanism: Cell size feedback operates through size deviations (difference between absolute size and cell-cycle progression). Feedback from size to growth rate and cycle timing creates coupled dynamics. In linear regime, dynamics reduce to stochastically forced harmonic oscillator. Cell-cycle timing and intrinsic fluctuations jointly shape size control strategy. Mechanistic feedback structure may differ from apparent coarse-grained correlations due to noise integration.

title: Distributed delay stabilizes bistable genetic networks
mechanism: Protein production involves delayed multi-step process (transcription, translation, folding, oligomerization). Delay is distributed (noisy) due to stochastic process durations. Increasing delay noise dramatically stabilizes metastable states in bistable circuits. Mean residence times in metastable states increase with delay distribution width. Distributed delay prevents unwanted switching caused by small fluctuations while allowing controlled transitions.

title: Imperfect molecular detection renormalizes apparent kinetic rates
mechanism: Imperfect molecular detection in single-cell measurements introduces technical noise obscuring true dynamics. Binomial capture models describe detection inefficiency. Under high transcription factor abundance or timescale separation, capture effects renormalize kinetic rates. Apparent mean burst size appears reduced while binding reactions appear faster. Technical noise reshapes observed statistics without changing underlying mechanism - creates measurement-induced effective parameters.

title: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks
mechanism: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.

title: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
mechanism_description: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.

title: Effect of higher-order interactions on noisy majority-rule dynamics with random group sizes
mechanism_description: Variable group sizes in majority-rule dynamics create heterogeneous influence through effective majority leverage. Rare large-group events can realign substantial population fractions. Critical threshold for independence depends on group-size distribution - heavy-tailed distributions enhance robustness to disorder through occasional macroscopic coordination events.

title: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
mechanism_description: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.

title: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
mechanism_description: Intermittent resource pulses interact with positive density dependence (Allee effects) to generate irregular spatial clusters. During favorable pulses, local facilitation enables patch expansion; during scarcity, neighborhood density determines survival. Resilience emerges from spatial covariance and local density rather than total biomass.

title: Tight FPT Approximations for Fair k-center with Outliers
mechanism_description: Iterative ball-finding with structural trichotomy decomposes fairness-constrained clustering into cases based on representation balance. Identify feasible balls satisfying group constraints while discarding outliers. Trichotomy (balanced, skewed-correctable, impossible) guides solution construction without projection, enabling approximation through case-by-case handling.

title: From semantic memory to collective creativity: A generative cognitive foundation for social creativity models
mechanism_description: Semantic network topology determines ideational breadth - low modularity yields broader exploration. When agents exchange ideation traces, lower pre-interaction overlap predicts larger stimulation gains. Shared inspiration sources create network-level redundancy as convergent semantic neighborhoods limit diversity of generated ideas.

title: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
mechanism_description: Local monomer depletion from network growth creates negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Higher density causes faster monomer consumption and slower growth. Multiple networks sharing finite monomer pool reach steady states through self-regulation. Under strong competition, coexistence transitions to selection.

title: Manipulation in Prediction Markets: An Agent-based Modeling Experiment
mechanism_description: High-budget agents (whales) shift market prices proportionally to their capital share. Distortion duration depends on non-whale learning rates and herding intensity. Fast learners correct distortions quickly; herding amplifies and prolongs whale influence as coordinated followers reinforce biased prices even when informed traders exit.

title: Locally Gentle State Certification for High Dimensional Quantum Systems
mechanism_description: Measurement gentleness constraint (α-bounded state perturbation) imposes information extraction penalty. Sample complexity scales as d/α² - the trade-off between disturbance and information parallels privacy mechanisms. Gentler measurements require more samples but preserve quantum state for reuse, creating fundamental efficiency-preservation trade-off.

title: SpecIBT: Formally Verified Protection Against Speculative Control-Flow Hijacking
mechanism_description: Combining hardware control-flow integrity with speculative load hardening creates conditional protection. BTB misspeculation detection sets misspeculation flag, triggering selective hardening only on mispredicted paths. Security cost activates only during attacks, not during normal execution - detection enables targeted rather than blanket protection.

title: Tuning interactions between static-field-shielded polar molecules with microwaves
mechanism_description: Microwave field modulates interaction potential of field-shielded molecules. S-wave scattering length tunable by microwave parameters while maintaining loss suppression. External field provides dynamic control over effective interactions without changing fundamental molecular properties - field-dressed states have tunable characteristics.

title: Phase Dynamics of Self-Accelerating Bose-Einstein Condensates
mechanism_description: Self-accelerating matter waves exhibit cubic phase evolution. Weak mean-field nonlinearities cause linear response in cubic coefficient - interaction strength directly modulates phase curvature. Phase extraction from interference patterns reveals nonlinearity effects through systematic windowed polynomial fitting accounting for window correlations.

title: Dimensional Peeking for Low-Variance Gradients in Zeroth-Order Discrete Optimization via Simulation
mechanism_description: Lift sampling granularity from scalar perturbations to equivalence classes (control-flow paths). Multiple parameter values following same code path share gradient information, reducing variance without introducing bias. Information-per-simulation increases by reusing structural similarities in discrete optimization landscape.

title: An Algorithm for Monitoring Edge-geodetic Sets in Chordal Graphs
mechanism_description: Minimal monitoring sets (vertices detecting edge failures through distance changes) have structural uniqueness in certain graph classes. Chordal graphs admit unique minimal meg-set due to structural constraints on shortest paths. Graph geometry determines single optimal monitoring configuration without algorithmic search.

title: Noisy nonlocal aggregation model with gradient flow structures
mechanism_description: Stochastic perturbations in nonlocal aggregation systems create gradient-flow structure in Wasserstein space. Noise regulates density and prevents singular concentration through equilibrium states from constrained energy minimization. Stable energy minimizers emerge from interplay between potential-driven interactions and environmental variability.

title: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
mechanism_description: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

title: Combination therapy for colorectal cancer with anti-PD-L1 and cancer vaccine: A multiscale mathematical model of tumor-immune interactions
mechanism_description: Multiple low-dose anti-PD-L1 reduces advanced tumor burden better than single high dose, while cancer vaccines show opposite pattern (maximum dose superior). Cytotoxic T-cell to regulatory T-cell ratio serves as robust pre-treatment biomarker. Different dose-response curves across therapies reflect distinct mechanisms of immune modulation.

title: A brief review of evolutionary game dynamics in the reinforcement learning paradigm
mechanism_description: Reinforcement learning paradigm differs from imitation learning by enabling introspective strategy refinement through trial-and-error rather than copying successful neighbors. Individuals learn from environmental feedback and adapt based on personal experience. This resolves discrepancies between theoretical predictions and behavioral experiments in cooperation, trust, and fairness.

title: Microbiome association diversity reflects proximity to the edge of instability
mechanism_description: Microbial communities operate near edge of instability - transition from stable fixed-point to chaos controlled by network sparsity and interaction heterogeneity. Effective stability parameter inferred from pairwise covariance distribution width. Healthy gut microbiomes cluster near instability edge with broader associations; dysbiosis shifts toward stable regimes with narrower association distributions.

title: Autodiscover: A reinforcement learning recommendation system for the cold-start imbalance challenge in active learning
mechanism_description: Discounted Thompson Sampling dynamically manages portfolio of query strategies in active learning. Agent balances exploration-exploitation under non-stationary review dynamics where strategy utility changes over time. Graph-aware attention learns relational structure while agent adapts strategy selection, mitigating cold-start failures through bootstrapping discovery from minimal labels.

title: AgentArk: Distilling Multi-Agent Intelligence into a Single LLM Agent
mechanism_description: Multi-agent iterative debate dynamics distilled into single model weights transforms explicit test-time interactions into implicit capabilities. Hierarchical distillation strategies shift computational burden from inference to training. Distilled models preserve multi-agent reasoning and self-correction while maintaining single-agent efficiency and demonstrating enhanced robustness across tasks.

title: Stable Time Series Prediction of Enterprise Carbon Emissions Based on Causal Inference
mechanism_description: Causal stable features (robust to external perturbations, stable long-term effects) extracted from multi-environment samples across policies and regions. Risk consistency constraints identify invariant causal relationships unaffected by distribution shifts. Adaptive normalization and sample reweighting dynamically correct temporal non-stationarity from economic fluctuations and policy transitions.

title: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
mechanism_description: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. Suppression occurs via frequency decoupling - driven neuron breaks from collective proto-event frequency dynamics, disrupting synchronized extreme event generation. Larger driven subpopulation enables earlier control onset, showing scaling advantage.

title: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
mechanism_description: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.

title: Compressing Complexity: Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
mechanism_description: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.

title: AgenticPay: Multi-Agent LLM Negotiation for Transactions
mechanism_description: Language-mediated economic negotiation among agents with private valuations and constraints. Multi-round linguistic negotiation replaces numeric bidding. Agreement emergence depends on strategic reasoning capability and constraint satisfaction through natural language. Performance gaps reveal challenges in long-horizon strategic planning distinct from immediate utility maximization.

title: Inverse Depth Scaling From Most Layers Being Similar
mechanism_description: Loss scales inversely with depth due to functionally similar layers reducing error through ensemble averaging rather than compositional learning. Residual architecture bias combined with incompatible target functions produces inefficient yet robust regime. Improving efficiency requires architectural innovations encouraging compositional depth usage instead of redundant layer averaging.

title: Path Integration and Object-Location Binding in Predictive Sequence Model
mechanism_description: Action-conditioned sequential prediction enables path integration and dynamic object-location binding for world modeling. Prediction accuracy improves across sequence through in-context learning. Structured representations with flexible binding emerge to support prediction - new bindings learnable late in sequence, out-of-distribution bindings acquirable through sequential exposure.

title: Information Processing Measures During Cognitive Tasks Using fMRI
mechanism_description: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.

title: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources
mechanism_description: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.

title: Strategic Interactions in Science and Technology Networks
mechanism_description: Productivity in scientific and technological activities increases with Katz-Bonacich centrality capturing within-activity and cross-activity complementarities. Scientific productivity significantly enhances technological output (asymmetric linkage), but technology does not reciprocally boost science. Science-driven innovation model where collaboration structure influences knowledge creation through network position and cross-domain spillovers.

title: Classification of SARS-CoV-2 Variants through Epistatical Circos Plots
mechanism_description: Epistatic interactions visualized as Circos plots enable variant classification through CNN recognition of higher-order genetic dependencies. Direct coupling analysis generates plot patterns representing inter-residue correlations. CNN captures complex epistatic features with 99.26% accuracy, demonstrating visual pattern recognition can reveal evolutionary dynamics and adaptive mechanisms through learned dependency structures.

title: Feature-Separated Cross-Attention Network for Multi-Dataset Training
mechanism_description: Feature disentanglement into domain-invariant and domain-specific components mitigates negative transfer in multi-dataset training. Cross-attention fusion adaptively models component interactions. Mutual information optimization maximizes domain-invariant consistency while minimizing domain-specific redundancy. Complementary shared-private representations enable knowledge transfer while preserving dataset-specific discriminability.

title: DreamDojo: Robot World Model from Large-Scale Human Videos
mechanism_description: Continuous latent actions serve as unified proxy actions, enabling interaction knowledge transfer from unlabeled human videos to robot control. World model learns diverse interactions from 44k hours of egocentric video. Post-training on small-scale robot data yields physics understanding and precise action controllability. Generative modeling enables teleoperation, policy evaluation, and planning.

title: Decoupling Variance and Scale-Invariant Updates in Adaptive Gradient Descent
mechanism_description: Decomposing AdaGrad into variance adaptation and scale-invariant terms creates unified framework bridging vector-based and matrix spectral optimization. Variance adaptation improves blockwise smoothness for faster convergence. Decoupling enables seamless transition from coordinate-wise adaptation (Adam) to spectral descent (Muon) by separating second-order correction from coordinate scaling.

title: Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning with Bi-level Optimization
mechanism_description: Local compressed module regularizes representations to constrain gradient variability, mitigating noise amplification in heterogeneous federated learning. Adaptive gradient clipping dynamically adjusts thresholds based on historical statistics to avoid over-clipping. Constraint-aware aggregation suppresses unreliable noise-dominated updates, stabilizing global optimization under differential privacy.

title: Markov Decision Processes: Learning Distributions by Policy Gradient
mechanism_description: Distributional MDPs steer cumulative reward distribution toward target law rather than optimizing expected value. Randomized Markov policies on augmented state space with characteristic-function loss enable distribution matching. Policy gradient converges to stationary points. Non-uniqueness phenomena emerge - multiple distinct policies can achieve same target distribution.

title: Residual Flow Diffusion Model for Efficient Causal Video Editing
mechanism_description: Residual-focused diffusion forward process encourages prediction of frame-to-frame differences, exploiting temporal redundancy. Causal conditioning on previous prediction enables variable-length video editing frame-by-frame. Focusing denoising on inter-frame changes rather than absolute content achieves efficiency of image models while handling video temporal structure autoregressively.

title: Optimal Abstractions for Verifying Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks
mechanism_description: Piecewise affine abstractions of nonlinear KAN activations enable property verification via MILP encoding. Optimal abstraction balances approximation pieces - too many cause intractability, too few yield uninformative bounds. Dynamic programming at unit level combined with knapsack optimization network-wide minimizes total pieces while guaranteeing error bounds.

title: Hypergraph Neural Networks for Multi-Agent Pathfinding
mechanism_description: Hypergraph attention captures group (beyond pairwise) coordination dynamics in multi-agent pathfinding. Standard GNNs limited to pairwise message passing suffer attention dilution in dense environments where group coordination is critical. Attentional mechanisms over directed hypergraphs explicitly model higher-order interactions, mitigating representational bottleneck and enabling complex coordination where pairwise methods fail.

title: Individual-Level Strategy Diversity in Differential Evolution
mechanism_description: Assigning mutation and crossover strategies independently to each individual at initialization and keeping them fixed creates persistent behavioral heterogeneity. Static individual-level diversity (no adaptation) cultivates search effectiveness especially with large populations. Communication-free construction enables intrinsic concurrency and efficient parallel execution.

title: Resting-State Connectivity Correlates of Emotional Memory Control
mechanism_description: Dissociable resting-state functional connectivity profiles support memory control efficiency across emotional valences. Efficient suppression of positive memories linked to reduced anterior cingulate-posterior perceptual coupling and diminished hippocampal-frontal connectivity. Suppression of negative memories associated with increased posterior parietal-lateral occipital connectivity. Anxiety moderates prefrontal connectivity relationships.

title: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
mechanism_description: Effective dispersal kernel encodes both microscopic dynamical parameters and network topology in coarse-grained metacommunity model. Metapopulation capacity generalizes to non-uniform local extinction rates. Stochasticity from finite carrying capacities yields reduced one-dimensional description with universal finite-size scaling laws for extinction times. Homogeneous environments require fine-tuned marginally stable coexistence to avoid monodominance.

title: Temporal niche differentiation through plasticity enables coexistence
mechanism_description: Temporal niche differentiation through phenotypic plasticity in circadian rhythms enables species coexistence. Phase-locking of coupled oscillators creates temporal resource partitioning. Plasticity allows dynamic adjustment of activity timing based on competitor presence. Coexistence emerges when plastic responses generate sufficient temporal separation in resource use patterns.

title: Nonlinear wave mixing via collective oscillations
mechanism_description: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.

title: Structure-aware imitation dynamics on higher-order networks
mechanism_description: Higher-order network structure (beyond pairwise) shapes imitation dynamics through group-dependent adoption rates. Information diversity achieved through structured sampling from local neighborhoods. Adoption probability depends on group composition and size, not just neighbor count. Network hypergraph structure determines equilibrium strategy distributions through sampling bias.

title: Bet-hedging through seed dormancy in fluctuating environments
mechanism_description: Seed dormancy as bet-hedging strategy in temporally fluctuating environments. Germination fraction trades off current reproduction against future survival through dormant seed bank. Optimal dormancy level depends on environmental variability - higher variance favors increased dormancy. Multi-year averaging through seed bank buffers against temporal unpredictability.

title: Division of labor emerges from heterogeneous thresholds
mechanism_description: Division of labor emerges from heterogeneous response thresholds combined with task-dependent positive feedback. Individuals with low thresholds specialize in corresponding tasks as they activate more frequently and self-reinforce. Threshold distribution determines whether population exhibits generalism or specialized subpopulations. Decentralized coordination through threshold heterogeneity without central control.

title: Adaptive immunity and infection dynamics under resource constraints
mechanism_description: Resource allocation trade-off between immune repertoire diversity and clone expansion. Broad repertoire enables better pathogen recognition but limits per-clone resources. Focused expansion provides strong response to known pathogens but reduces diversity. Optimal strategy depends on pathogen encounter rate and diversity - high diversity environments favor broad repertoires despite weaker per-clone responses.

title: Dr. Kernel: RL for Kernel Generation
mechanism_description: Turn-level Reinforce-Leave-One-Out provides unbiased advantage estimation for multi-turn RL by excluding self from baseline. Prevents biased policy gradient from self-inclusion in GRPO. Profiling-based rewards and rejection sampling overcome lazy optimization where models hack training rewards prioritizing trivial correctness over meaningful optimization. Multi-turn mismatch correction ensures training stability.
